pullRequest.body:
Prove Part 1 of Claim 1.(i) of Theorem 6.1 in https://www3.nd.edu/~andyp/notes/AKS.pdf.

----

Zulip discussion: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Aks.20primality.20Theorem.206.2E1.20Claim.20.28i.29.20proven

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b18ab7cd2a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19526/commits/b18ab7cd2adb937f45b1a18cd9fcebfd8128761f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.AKSPrimality` (new file)|1239|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ prime_is_introspective_for_linear_factors`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Please remove the `awaiting-author` label once you have dealt with the suggestions.
Please also clarify the PR title - it is currently completely meaningless to me.

```suggestion
lemma aks_6d1c1ip1 (p r a : ) [Fact p.Prime]
```
everywhere

```suggestion
    (: primitiveRoots r (AlgebraicClosure (ZMod p))):
    ((: (AlgebraicClosure (ZMod p)))-a)^p = ^p-a :=by
```
Statement must be indented 4 spaces.

```suggestion
 (: primitiveRoots r (AlgebraicClosure (ZMod p))):
 ((: (AlgebraicClosure (ZMod p)))-a)^p = ^p-a := by
```
and below

A more general version of this lemma already exists in mathlib, as the following proof demonstrates:
```suggestion
lemma prime_is_introspective_for_linear_factors (p a : ) [Fact p.Prime]
    (K : Type*) [Field K] [CharP K p]
    ( : K) :
    (( : K) - a)^p = ^p-a := by
  simp [ frobenius_def]
```

I think this PR should try to formalize all of 6.1. This current step shouldn't be a separate lemma.

Note also that the first step on paper isn't talking about `^ p` but `^ n`.

I think without continuous feedback I'll be stuck quite a bit and I won't be able to have much if not any progress. Maybe once claim 1 is proven we can collapse it or just have it a private lemma.
Anyways the claim 1(i) says this 
```
we have p  x  a and n/p  x  a.
```
Next I'd like to show  n/p  x  a, which I already did, but I guess I need to clean it up and put it in the PR

pullRequest.title: feat:closure properties of numbers that are introspective to polynomials
